SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.filters

Class FilterConfiguration

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.filters.FilterConfiguration
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultFilterConfiguration
public abstract class FilterConfiguration extends Object
Defines an abstract configuration mechanism for filters within the Jolt framework. Provides capabilities to exclude specific routes from filtering, dynamically exclude routes based on predicates, and assign custom ordering to filters.

Subclasses should implement configure() to perform actual configuration steps.

Since:
1.0

    protected final Map<JoltFilter,Integer>
    filterOrders
    Maintains filter instances mapped to their assigned order.

  • Method Details

    • configure

      public abstract void configure()
      Performs any necessary filter configuration steps.

      Intended to be overridden by subclasses providing additional setup logic.

    • exclude

      public FilterConfiguration exclude(String... routes)
      Excludes the specified routes from filtering.
      Parameters:
      routes - One or more route paths to be excluded
      Returns:
      This configuration instance for method chaining

    • excludeIf

      public FilterConfiguration excludeIf(Predicate<JoltContext> routePredicate)
      Excludes routes if they satisfy the provided predicate.
      Parameters:
      routePredicate - A predicate that, if true, excludes the route
      Returns:
      This configuration instance for method chaining

    • setOrder

      public FilterConfiguration setOrder(int order, JoltFilter filter)
      Assigns an order to the given filter. Filters with lower order values are processed earlier.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to assign
      filter - The filter instance to order
      Returns:
      This configuration instance for method chaining

    • getOrder

      public int getOrder(JoltFilter filter)
      Retrieves the assigned order for the specified filter.
      Parameters:
      filter - The filter instance
      Returns:
      The order value, or Integer.MAX_VALUE if no order is set

    • shouldExcludeRoute

      public boolean shouldExcludeRoute(JoltContext context)
      Determines if the specified route should be excluded from filtering.
      Parameters:
      context - The current JoltContext
      Returns:
      true if the route is excluded, false otherwise

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets all configured routes, predicates, and filter orders.
